page.title: 20ROYAL COLLEGE FOR BLIND
page.content: The College was founded 113 yers go and housed in two separate buildings 11 miles apart in Shropshire. Seven years ago it all came together and moved to the former Teacher Training College in Hereford.The College in Hereford was officially opened in July 1979 by Prince Charles.The College has had other famous visitors including Yehudi Menuhin who opened the Sobell Department piano tuning in May 1985. Very few of the students are totally blind.Most were not born blind but have developed difficulties or had accidents. Some students live out in the town. They study a great many subjects and take "O" and "A" levels. The College accepts any students, over the age of 16, if they can be helped. Most stay 3 years and there are usually 220 students at any one time.
